concise_definition: adj. 炸的, 煎的; (俚) 疲惫的, 神经衰弱的; (非正式) 烧坏的

definitions.explanation_en: Cooked by immersion in hot oil or fat, typically until crispy or golden brown; commonly used to describe foods such as French fries, fried chicken, or onion rings.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过将食物浸入热油或脂肪中烹制，通常直至外皮酥脆或呈金黄色；常用于描述炸薯条、炸鸡或洋葱圈等食物。
definitions.example_en: We ordered fried chicken and mashed potatoes for dinner.
definitions.example_cn: 我们晚餐点了炸鸡和土豆泥。

definitions.explanation_en: Informal: Exhausted, mentally overwhelmed, or emotionally drained, often due to stress, overwork, or excessive stimulation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 非正式用法：指因压力、过度劳累或过度刺激而感到精疲力竭、精神崩溃或情绪耗尽的状态。
definitions.example_en: After three all-nighters in a row, I'm completely fried.
definitions.example_cn: 连续熬了三个通宵，我彻底崩溃了。

definitions.explanation_en: Slang: Damaged or malfunctioning, especially referring to electronic devices or circuits that have been overheated or overloaded.
definitions.explanation_cn: 俚语：指电子设备或电路因过热或过载而损坏、无法正常工作。
definitions.example_en: My laptop got fried during the power surge.
definitions.example_cn: 我的笔记本电脑在电压突增时烧坏了。

comparison.analysis: “Fried” 作为烹饪术语，与 “deep-fried” 几乎同义，但 “fried” 更通用，可泛指任何油炸方式（包括浅炸、煎炸）；而 “deep-fried” 特指完全浸入热油中炸制，强调深度油炸的工艺。
“Burnt” (烧焦的) 指因过度加热导致食物碳化或变苦，带有负面含义；而 “fried” 通常指恰到好处的油炸状态，是预期的烹饪结果。两者在结果和语义色彩上截然不同：fried = 美味，burnt = 失败。
“Exhausted” (精疲力尽的) 是正式用语，描述生理或心理上的极度疲劳，适用于所有语境；而 “fried” 是非正式俚语，语气更强烈、更口语化，常用于年轻人或情绪化表达中，带有夸张色彩。
